## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I have a few questions about creating currencies with Verus. Can you explain why it's recommended to use an i-address as the actual name of an ID when creating a currency?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, it's the opposite: it's not recommended to use an i-address as the actual name of an ID when creating a currency. In fact, the advice is to "not do that" because it can cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used. Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration.

**User:**
That makes sense. Another question: Is it possible to use a currency name like BTC or ETH as a PBaaS chain in the Verus Desktop?

**AI Assistant:**
No, it's not possible to use a currency name like BTC or ETH as a PBaaS chain in the Verus Desktop, at least not in this testnet release. This is a known limitation that will be resolved before mainnet availability.

**User:**
I just updated to a new version of Verus. Do I need to delete any directories after updating to this new version?

**AI Assistant:**
Only if you have last launched VRSCTEST from a version prior to this release. In that case, you need to delete specific directories before running this new update. The directories to delete depend on your operating system: `~/.komodo/vrsctest` for Linux, `⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/vrsctest` for MacOS, and `"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST` for Windows.
Can you explain why it's recommended to use an i-address as the actual name of an ID when creating a currency?

Actually, it's the opposite: it's not recommended to use an i-address as the actual name of an ID when creating a currency. In fact, the advice is to "not do that" because it can cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used. Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration.

## Limitations in multi-currency to be aware of:
1. (GUI and CLI) You will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. Generally, the advice is “don’t do that”. Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies. To reduce any potential for user confusion, even though the naming system provides will also be expanding the set of characters that will not be allowed for currency registrations.2. (GUI) If a currency is supported in the Verus Desktop already, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is considered errata for this testnet release and will not be a limitation before mainnet availability.## Testnet Reset
The testnet was deleted and relaunched on this release. **IF YOU HAVE LAST LAUNCHED VRSCTEST FROM A VERSION PRIOR TO THIS, PLEASE DELETE THE FOLLOWING DIRECTORIES BEFORE RUNNING THIS NEW UPDATE:**
**Linux:**
```
~/.komodo/vrsctest
```**MacOS**
```
 ⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/vrsctest
```**Windows**
```
"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST
```# Disclaimer
